item.title: Risk-On Mood Weighs on Dollar
item.description: The dollar remained under pressure as the risk-on mood continued in global markets after the Fed left interest rates unchanged earlier this week.

item.title: Fitch's Italy Review Next Week Is a Test of Demand for BTP
item.description: Fitch’s review of Italy on Nov. 10 will test appetite for Italian government bonds after the recent spread narrowing, Societe Generale said.

item.title: Maersk to Slash Jobs as Industry Faces New Normal
item.description: Maersk said it will cut more than 10,000 jobs as it steps up cost savings, with the industry facing subdued demand, lower freight rates and inflationary pressure.

item.title: BMW Keeps Forecast as Profits Rise
item.description: BMW confirmed its full-year guidance after underlying earnings in the third quarter rose along with the auto EBIT margin.

item.title: 'Lawmen: Bass Reeves' Review: Freedom on the Frontier
item.description: David Oyelowo plays the first black deputy marshal west of the Mississippi in this sturdy, entertaining series on Paramount+, which also features Dennis Quaid and Donald Sutherland.

item.title: Macquarie to Launch Up to $1.29 Billion Buyback Despite Fall in Profit
item.description: Macquarie Group said first-half net profit fell by 39% but its strong capital position means it could soon begin buying back shares worth up to $1.29 billion.

item.title: Swiss Re Outlook on Track After Profit Return
item.description: Swiss Re maintained its profit target for the year of more than $3 billion after lower natural-catastrophe claims helped the insurer swing to a net profit in the third quarter.

item.title: Australia Shares Rise 1.1%, Round Out Weekly Gain
item.description: Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 closed 1.1% higher at 6978.2, completing its strongest weekly gain since early September amid easing interest-rate worries.

item.title: How Italy Plans to Build the World's Longest Suspension Bridge
item.description: Italy’s parliament has approved a plan to build the world’s longest suspension bridge between Sicily and the mainland, an area prone to 170-mph winds, powerful riptides, and earthquakes. WSJ explains the technical plans that may make it feasible.

item.title: Israel Has Invaded Gaza Before. Here's What Happened.
item.description: Israel has sent ground troops into Gaza to eradicate Hamas, after the militant group launched a surprise assault on Oct. 7. WSJ looks back at Israel’s previous ground offensives into the Palestinian enclave to see what that reveals tells us about the challenges ahead for the Israeli military.

item.title: Israel's Quest to Identify Every Victim of Hamas Leaves Scientists Exhausted, Traumatized
item.description: Forensic specialists have come from around the world to work with the remains of those killed in the Oct. 7 massacre; “it doesn’t stop.”

item.title: FBI agents searched the Brooklyn home of a fundraiser for New York City Mayor Eric Adams, who canceled meetings in Washington to return to New York.
item.description: FBI agents searched the Brooklyn home of a fundraiser for New York City Mayor Eric Adams, who canceled meetings in Washington to return to New York.

item.title: Amazon executives discussed how its pricing policies had a "punitive aspect" on sellers, according to internal documents quoted in newly unredacted portions of the FTC's monopoly lawsuit against the company.
item.description: Amazon executives discussed how its pricing policies had a “punitive aspect” on sellers, according to internal documents quoted in newly unredacted portions of the FTC’s monopoly lawsuit against the company.

item.title: Pakistanbegan rounding up tens of thousands of undocumented Afghansfor deportationback to Afghanistan, prompting fearsthat some awaiting resettlement to the U.S. could be swept up.
item.description: Pakistan began rounding up tens of thousands of undocumented Afghans for deportation back to Afghanistan, prompting fears that some awaiting resettlement to the U.S. could be swept up.

item.title: The IRS won a $109 million court case against telecom company Liberty Global that will help the tax agency combat aggressive corporate tax maneuvers and collect more money from other firms.
item.description: The IRS won a $109 million court case against telecom company Liberty Global that will help the tax agency combat aggressive corporate tax maneuvers and collect more money from other firms.

item.title: Wagner Group, the Russian paramilitaryorganization, plans toprovide an air-defense system to Hezbollah,the Lebanese militia, U.S. officials said, citing intelligence.
item.description: Wagner Group, the Russian paramilitary organization, plans to provide an air-defense system to Hezbollah, the Lebanese militia, U.S. officials said, citing intelligence.

item.title: A former Memphis police officer agreed to plead guilty to murder charges in the fatal police beating of Tyre Nichols in January as part of a deal with federal and Tennessee prosecutors.
item.description: A former Memphis police officer agreed to plead guilty to murder charges in the fatal police beating of Tyre Nichols in January as part of a deal with federal and Tennessee prosecutors.

item.title: The House passed Republicans' $14.3 billion Israel-aid bill on a 226-196 vote, setting up a fight with the Democratic-controlled Senate, which is pursuing a much larger package that includes assistance to Ukraine.
item.description: The House passed Republicans’ $14.3 billion Israel-aid bill on a 226-196 vote, setting up a fight with the Democratic-controlled Senate, which is pursuing a much larger package that includes assistance to Ukraine.

item.title: Toyota recalled more than 1.8 million RAV4 vehicles over a battery issue that poses a potential fire risk, the company said.
item.description: Toyota recalled more than 1.8 million RAV4 vehicles over a battery issue that poses a potential fire risk, the company said.

item.title: Israeli forces pushed across Gaza and in from the Mediterranean coast, cutting the enclave in two and isolating densely populated urban areas in the north where armored and infantry units were battling Hamas militants, the Israeli military and the U.N. said.
item.description: Israeli forces pushed across Gaza and in from the Mediterranean coast, cutting the enclave in two and isolating densely populated urban areas in the north where armored and infantry units were battling Hamas militants, the Israeli military and the U.N. said.
